trans-unit.source: ACS Architecture
trans-unit.target: ACS Architecture

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: ACS Architecture
trans-unit.target: ACS Architecture

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines the architecture and key components of <token>firstref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines the architecture and key components of <token>firstref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Security Token Service
trans-unit.target: Security Token Service

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Security Token Service (STS) is the set of endpoints that issue tokens to your relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Security Token Service (STS) is the set of endpoints that issue tokens to your relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: In other words, STS is the service that <token>secondref_acs</token> uses to provide federated authentication to your web applications and services.
trans-unit.target: In other words, STS is the service that <token>secondref_acs</token> uses to provide federated authentication to your web applications and services.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> supports a variety of protocols that allow it to be accessed from any web platform including .NET Framework, WCF, Silverlight, ASP.NET, Java, Python, Ruby, PHP, and Flash.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> supports a variety of protocols that allow it to be accessed from any web platform including .NET Framework, WCF, Silverlight, ASP.NET, Java, Python, Ruby, PHP, and Flash.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> supports the following protocols:
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> supports the following protocols:

trans-unit.source: OAuth WRAP
trans-unit.target: OAuth WRAP

trans-unit.source: OAuth 2.0
trans-unit.target: OAuth 2.0

trans-unit.source: WS-Trust
trans-unit.target: WS-Trust

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="ccfc4118-5d5b-4ac0-9dba-d5225cfc6745" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Protocols Supported in ACS 2.0</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="ccfc4118-5d5b-4ac0-9dba-d5225cfc6745" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Protocols Supported in ACS 2.0</link>.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> supports the following security token formats:
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> supports the following security token formats:

trans-unit.source: JSON Web Token (JWT)
trans-unit.target: JSON Web Token (JWT)

trans-unit.source: SAML 1.1
trans-unit.target: SAML 1.1

trans-unit.source: SAML 2.0
trans-unit.target: SAML 2.0

trans-unit.source: Simple Web Token (SWT)
trans-unit.target: Simple Web Token (SWT)

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="5fd7e09f-0c5b-4571-943e-c743ee0bac9d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Token Formats Supported in ACS 2.0</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="5fd7e09f-0c5b-4571-943e-c743ee0bac9d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Token Formats Supported in ACS 2.0</link>.

trans-unit.source: The URI’s to specific endpoints can be obtained through the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The URI’s to specific endpoints can be obtained through the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: URI’s can be used for different tasks.
trans-unit.target: URI’s can be used for different tasks.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The WS-Federation Metadata endpoint URI can be used when integrating web applications with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: The WS-Federation Metadata endpoint URI can be used when integrating web applications with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: WS-Federation metadata can be consumed by a WIF application (or other WS-Federation-compliant application) in order to share certificate information and automate configuration.
trans-unit.target: WS-Federation metadata can be consumed by a WIF application (or other WS-Federation-compliant application) in order to share certificate information and automate configuration.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service endpoint URI can be used when programmatically managing an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service endpoint URI can be used when programmatically managing an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> with the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: ACS 2.0 Management Portal
trans-unit.target: ACS 2.0 Management Portal

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal is a web-based user interface that <token>secondref_acs</token> administrators can use to manage the configuration settings of a specific <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal is a web-based user interface that <token>secondref_acs</token> administrators can use to manage the configuration settings of a specific <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Portal</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="07b7daf4-b4d6-48fc-b921-3b1e63d44f61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Portal</link>.

trans-unit.source: Management Service
trans-unit.target: Management Service

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service makes it possible for you to manage <token>secondref_acs</token> programmatically, using the Open Data (OData) protocol.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service makes it possible for you to manage <token>secondref_acs</token> programmatically, using the Open Data (OData) protocol.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: Token Transformation Rule Engine
trans-unit.target: Token Transformation Rule Engine

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> rule engine is used to process the input claims that are present in the security tokens that <token>secondref_acs</token> receives from clients and to generate output claims that are present in the security tokens that <token>secondref_acs</token> issues to relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> rule engine is used to process the input claims that are present in the security tokens that <token>secondref_acs</token> receives from clients and to generate output claims that are present in the security tokens that <token>secondref_acs</token> issues to relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
